description: The 'Attention Is All You Need' paper is published, introducing the Transformer architecture, which becomes the foundational design for most modern LLMs.
OpenAI releases GPT-3, a 175B parameter model showcasing remarkable few-shot and zero-shot learning capabilities, popularizing the concept of emergent abilities.
OpenAI publishes the InstructGPT paper, detailing how Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) can significantly improve LLM alignment and instruction following.
OpenAI launches ChatGPT, a conversational AI based on GPT-3.5, making advanced LLM capabilities widely accessible and sparking massive public interest.

eventName: Meta AI Launches the LLaMA Fleet
description: Meta AI releases the LLaMA models, providing powerful open-source alternatives and catalyzing research and development in the open LLM community.
The Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) paper is published, offering a more stable and computationally efficient alternative to PPO-based RLHF.
Anthropic releases the Claude 3 model family, with Opus setting new benchmarks for reasoning and general capabilities.
DeepSeek AI releases DeepSeek-R1, an open-source model with exceptional reasoning abilities, trained with innovative cold-start RL techniques.
Speculation and early reports emerge about OpenAI's next-generation reasoning model, codenamed 'o1', promising significant leaps in complex problem-solving.

eventName: The Rise of MoE Armada (Mixture of Experts)
description: Models like Mixtral popularize the Mixture of Experts (MoE) architecture, enabling vastly larger models with efficient inference by sparsely activating parameters.
